meanings.def: to make something, especially a building, by putting parts together
examples: build (something) They have permission to build 200 new homes.
to build a plant/facility/structure
We build computer systems for large companies.
Robins build nests almost anywhere.
They don't have the money to build roads.
They're going to build on the site of the old power station.
be built from/of/out of something The houses are built out of local stone.
be built in something apartment blocks built in brick and concrete
build something for somebody They had a house built for them.
build somebody something David built us a shed in the back yard.
a house built of stone
They’re going to build on the site of the old power station.
The cupboard is easy to assemble.
Police had to erect barriers to keep crowds back.
They’re putting up new hotels in order to boost tourism in the area.
They are trying to build long-term relationships.
It is important to build a network of like-minded colleagues.
to build a community/society
We want to build a better life.
We focused on building the business one customer at a time.
She has built a reputation as a hard-working judge.
She's built a new career for herself.
This information will help us build a picture of his attacker.
The tension and excitement built gradually all day.

meanings.def: (to have) plans or dreams that are not likely to happen or come true
examples: As a child he would wander round the boatyards, building castles in the air about owning a boat one day.

meanings.def: used to say that a complicated task will take a long time and should not be rushed

idioms.def: (to have) plans or dreams that are not likely to happen or come true
examples: As a child he would wander round the boatyards, building castles in the air about owning a boat one day.

idioms.idiom: Rome wasn’t built in a day
idioms.def: used to say that a complicated task will take a long time and should not be rushed

meanings.def: the shape and size of the human body
examples: He was described as a man of average build.
to be of medium/strong build
She is slight of build and very agile.
a small woman with a slim build
He's heavier in build than his brother.

meanings.def: the process of building or constructing something
examples: We are just completing the build of our new house.
A defined build process ensures that your project's software is built and tested identically each time.

meanings.def: a version of a piece of software that is created, especially one of a series of versions created before the final version is released
examples: You can sign up to help them test the alpha build of the game.

meanings.def: the form or style in which something is constructed, especially a vehicle
examples: a car with superb build quality
The car has an impressive range of luxury features and superb build quality.

meanings.def: the way in which something, especially a story or film, develops towards the most exciting or important point
examples: the slow build of the plot
